vacancies.Job description: "The Global Alliance for Improved Nutrition (GAIN) is seeking for a Project Manager, CASCADE to support the implementation of CASCADE project activities at GAIN Mozambique office. The Project Manager will provide strategic orientation while leading the overall CASCADE project components, in addition to leading project related technical assistance and implementation of activities as defined in the project proposal and work plan to meet set goals. Reporting to the External Engagement Manager, the Project Manager will monitor and manage the progress of CASCADE Project in Mozambique and oversee the operational management of Nacala office. Key responsibilities include: Leading in providing oversight, technical direction, and implementation of strategies and interventions as desired under the project as per the GAIN Project Management [...]"

vacancies.Job description: "Reporting into: Global Director, Performance, Evidence, and Insights. The Global MEL Sr. Manager will create systems and tools to strengthen MEL approaches across the organisation and with partners, provide technical support to country teams, and lead a portfolio of MEL projects. The Global MEL Sr. Manager will strengthen a coordinated organisation-wide MEL system, facilitate the design, set-up, and implementation of standard MEL processes in close collaboration with country MEL teams, and ensure that data and analysis are used to make [...]"

"The main purpose of the role is to analyse and interpret quantitative monitoring and evaluation (M&E) and research data generated across Malaria Consortium’s SMC programme. The Data Analyst is responsible for analysing and interpreting data in support of the SMC programme’s efforts to generate robust high-quality evidence of performance and impact, and to use this evidence to inform improvements. The role contributes to shaping the SMC programme’s M&E and research agenda, as well as implementing relevant frameworks and strategies. It works closely with M&E and research colleagues at country and programme level to ensure high quality of programme outputs and build capacity across the SMC team. Reporting to: Senior Epidemiologist. Key working relationships: Senior Epidemiologist. Research Advisor. Results [...]"

"We are looking for a Project Coordinator for our contribution to the Dietary Guidelines Initiative. The Project Coordinator will be working closely with several internal stakeholders such as the Research, Communications and Policy teams as well as our ProVeg countries and our external partner organisations to ensure that all project requirements, deadlines, and schedules are on track. Reports to: Project Lead Dietary Guidelines/ Senior Nutrition and Health Specialist. Growing the supporter and endorser network of the initiative through bespoke outreach. Meeting with project team members to identify and resolve issues. Submitting project [...]"

"How You Will Make a Difference As a fellow, you will have the opportunity to advance GFI’s mission by conducting research on timely regulatory and legislative issues facing the alternative protein industry and producing high-quality research memoranda that will support the Policy Team’s work. The Regulatory and Legislative Fall Fellow will be responsible for the following: Conducting legal and policy research related to the regulation of alternative proteins. Conducting policy research related to state funding opportunities for alternative protein research. Producing clear legal analysis. Drafting research memoranda on topics related to the regulation of alternative proteins and state funding for alternative protein research. Attending internal and external meetings, workshops, and webinars as applicable. Performing [...]"

vacancies.Hiring organisation ID: University of Washington, Institute for Health Metrics and Evaluation
vacancies.Job description: "IHME has an excellent opportunity for a Lead Research Scientist in Neonatal and Child Health. As a Lead Research Scientist, you will co-lead a growing dynamic research team focused on multiple topics related to maternal, perinatal, and child health including birth defects, prematurity and fetal growth restriction, neonatal encephalopathy, sepsis, cerebral palsy, hemolytic disease, anemia and blood disorders, child growth failure, maternal care coverage, and oral disorders. You will develop and lead execution of research strategy; establish deadlines, deliverables, and resources; and provide methodological advice, interpretation, statistical analysis, and visualisation of research area to meet IHME’s objectives. Responsibilities: Lead a research project and/or research team in defining, executing, and managing analytic plans; developing [...]"

vacancies.Job description: "Position Summary & Core Responsibilities: As a key member of the Chemistry, Manufacturing and Controls Domain, the Senior Strategy Officer, is accountable for supporting the execution and management of key initiative areas. You will partner closely with the Deputy Director (DD), Vaccine Development CMC and Deputy Director, Strategy Planning and Management (DDSPM) to contribute to the continued development of the team’s strategic vision including participating in the setting of the overall strategy and goals for the group. This person will be a member of the business team and report to our DDSPM. Key responsibilities will include: CMC Strategic Support: Partner with Deputy Director (DD), Vaccine Development & Surveillance (VD&S) CMC, as well as other CMC team members and experts across subject areas, to drive [...]"

"The Program Assistant is an integral member of the team, ensuring that all administrative and scheduling functions are completed in a timely manner allowing for highly productive environments! The Program Assistant will provide a wide and varied range of organisational and administrative support to the leaders and staff in the Nigeria Country Office while assisting with project coordination and collaborating with a small team of other assistants to support the overall work and ensure the smooth running of the Nigeria office based in Abuja. Core Responsibilities: Schedule numerous appointments and meetings while managing complex calendars for multiple people, and making travel arrangements. Proactively review upcoming weeks/months and support principals with planning, recognising potential bottlenecks and making [...]"

Vegan cooking (twice a week on average). Working with the other managers to ensure that all tasks have someone taking responsibility for them, and none fall between the cracks. Biases that prevent choosing the most effective options for improving wellbeing (effective altruism). Decisions that will affect others who are distant in terms of demographics, culture, space, time, or species (moral circle). Responsibilities include (but not limited to): Literature research, summaries. Conducting and reporting analyses for survey experiments. Setting up studies on Qualtrics. Tasks also include overall project management, developing and maintaining budgets, establishing timelines, tracking project deliverables, keeping the project and its members on task and schedule, and working with other groups within the organisation to ensure [...]"

Global Alliance for Improved Nutrition.name: Global Alliance for Improved Nutrition
Global Alliance for Improved Nutrition.description: The Global Alliance for Improved Nutrition is a Swiss-based foundation launched at the United Nations in 2002 to tackle the human suffering caused by malnutrition. Working with governments, NGOs, the private sector, and Academia, it aims to transform food systems so that they deliver more nutritious foods for all people, especially the most vulnerable. By understanding that there is no "one-size-fits-all" way of dealing with the problem, they develop alliances and build tailored programmes using a variety of models and approaches. They have offices in countries with high levels of malnutrition: Bangladesh, Ethiopia, India, Indonesia, Kenya, Mozambique, Nigeria, Pakistan, and Tanzania. To support work in those countries, they have representative offices in Denmark, the Netherlands, the United Kingdom, and the United States.

LivingGoods.name: LivingGoods
LivingGoods.description: Living Goods helps governments ensure that community health workers (CHW) can deliver high-quality services. They do this via data-driven performance management, incentive systems, regular in-service training, and supportive supervision that empowers local CHWs who to better deliver on-demand life-saving care, including treating sick children, counseling women on modern family planning choices, and delivering high-impact medicines and health products. Without attempting to replace licensed doctors and nurses, CHWs help relieve the burden on hospitals and facilities in resource-strapped areas by reaching more people before their health conditions turn life-threatening. Effectively utilized CHWs can prevent more than 3 million child deaths annually while also providing a 1:10 return on investment.

Malaria Consortium.name: Malaria Consortium
Malaria Consortium.description: Malaria Consortium is one of the world’s leading non-profit organisations specialising in the prevention, control, and treatment of communicable diseases among vulnerable populations. They focus on Malaria, NTDs, Dengue, Pneumonia, Diarrhoea, and Malnutrition in 12 countries across Africa and Southeast Asia, creating evidence-based solutions that have a positive impact on the wider health system and economy. They partner with all levels of government to (1) design and implement cutting edge research and evaluation, (2) scale up and deliver sustainable programmes, (3) provide technical assistance and consulting services that shape national and international health policies and systems, and (4) ensure that their experience and findings are effectively communicated and contribute to improving the access to and quality of healthcare.

ProVeg International.name: ProVeg International
ProVeg International.description: ProVeg is a leading international food awareness organisation working across four continents to substantially reduce the global consumption of animals. They encourage people to choose tasty and healthy foods that are good for all humans, animals, and the planet, and they collaborate with governments, public institutions, and the food industry to improve the taste, ease, and accessibility of plant-based food. Their projects include awareness campaigns, community building, corporate engagement, and political outreach.

The Good Food Institute.name: The Good Food Institute
The Good Food Institute.description:
The Good Food Institute is a nonprofit that works with scientists, investors, and entrepreneurs to produce plant-based alternatives to animal products — foods that are tasty, safe to eat, and better for the planet than their meat-based counterparts.

GFI provides marketing, design, legal, business, media, and other support to a select number of early-stage companies producing plant-based products, and help the products of more established companies succeed in the marketplace by mobilizing supportive consumers to encourage their sale in stores, restaurants, and foodservice outlets. They also connect students, scientists, and entrepreneurs with opportunities in the academic and for-profit sectors, and educate grant-making institutions, corporations, and governmental bodies on plant-based meat R&D as a critical component of endeavors related to sustainability, climate change, and global health.

Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation.name: Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation
Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation.description: The Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation works to reduce inequity based on the belief that all lives have equal value. In developing countries, they focus on improving people’s health and well-being, helping individuals lift themselves out of hunger and extreme poverty. In the United States, they seek to ensure that all people—especially those with the fewest resources—can access the opportunities they need to succeed in school and life.

Centre For Enabling EA Learning & Resear.name: Centre For Enabling EA Learning & Research

New York University, Leonard N. Stern Sc.name: New York University, Leonard N. Stern School of Business

US Government, Agency for International.name: US Government, Agency for International Development

Brookings Institution.name: Brookings Institution
Brookings Institution.description: The Brookings Institution is a DC-based nonprofit public policy organization that aims to conduct in-depth research that leads to new ideas for solving problems facing society at the local, national, and global level. It brings together more than 300 experts in government and academia from around the world who provide research, policy recommendations, and analysis on a full range of public policy issues.

Council on Foreign Relations.name: Council on Foreign Relations
Council on Foreign Relations.description: The Council on Foreign Relations is one of the most influential foreign policy think tanks in the United States.

Founders Pledge.name: Founders Pledge
Founders Pledge.description: Founders Pledge is an international nonprofit that encourages startup founders and investors to make a legally binding pledge to donate a portion of their personal proceeds from exit to charity. They seek to establish impactful giving as the norm, not the exception, in the startup ecosystem. Operating in the UK, the US, and Germany, they equip their community of entrepreneurs with charity research, a streamlined giving infrastructure, and a global network of experts to learn from, so that they can make strategic and informed giving choices. Their members have collectively pledged over $2 billion to high-impact charities and fulfilled over $230 million of those commitments.

New York University, Effective Altruism.name: New York University, Effective Altruism Psychology Lab

Open Philanthropy.name: Open Philanthropy
Open Philanthropy.description:
The Open Philanthropy Project is a grant-making and research nonprofit that identifies outstanding giving opportunities, makes grants, follows the results, and publishes their findings. Their mission is to give as effectively as possible and share their findings openly so that anyone can build on their work. Current giving areas include global health and development, scientific research, U.S. policy (primarily criminal justice reform and farm animal welfare), and global catastrophic risks (primarily biosecurity and pandemic preparedness, and potential risks from advanced artificial intelligence). Their main funders are Cari Tuna and Dustin Moskovitz, a co-founder of Facebook and Asana.

Disclaimer of conflict of interest: 80,000 Hours and our parent organisation, the Centre For Effective Altruism, have received funding from the Open Philanthropy Project.

Principles of Intelligent Behavior in Bi.name: Principles of Intelligent Behavior in Biological and Social Systems

University of Chicago, Bulletin of Atomi.name: University of Chicago, Bulletin of Atomic Scientists
University of Chicago, Bulletin of Atomi.description: The Bulletin of the Atomic Scientists believes that advances in science and technology should make life on earth better, not worse. They equip the public, policy makers, and scientists with the information needed to demand, recognize, and support public policies that reduce manmade existential threats such as nuclear war, climate change, and disruptive technologies. The Bulletin focuses its coverage on three topics: Nuclear risk, climate change, and disruptive technologies. What links them together is that these are man-made threats to our existence.

Imperial College London, Schistosomiasis.name: Imperial College London, Schistosomiasis Control Initiative
Imperial College London, Schistosomiasis.description: The Schistosomiasis Control Initiative at Imperial College London is a non-profit foundation that helps governments in sub-Saharan African countries develop sustainable and highly effective programmes against parasitic worm infections.  Since their foundation in 2002, they've supported the delivery of over 200 million treatments against diseases like schistosomiasis and intestinal worms, and have been consistently ranked as one of the most cost-effective non-profits in the world by the international charity evaluator GiveWell. An evidence-based approach informs their practices and decisions, and a focus on supporting governments and strengthen existing systems ensures that their work is sustainable.

Georgetown University, Center for Securi.name: Georgetown University, Center for Security and Emerging Technology
Georgetown University, Center for Securi.description: The recently-founded Center for Security and Emerging Technology at Georgetown’s Walsh School of Foreign Service is a research organization that aims to prepare a generation of policymakers, analysts, and diplomats to address the challenges and opportunities of emerging technologies. Their focus is on studying the security impacts of these technologies, supporting academic work in security and technology studies, and delivering relevant nonpartisan analysis to the policy community. During its first two years, CSET plans to concentrate on the effects of progress in artificial intelligence and advanced computing.

In-Q-Tel.name: In-Q-Tel
In-Q-Tel.description: IQT invests in commercially-focused startups to identify and adapt cutting-edge technology products that can be modified, tested, and delivered quickly and cost effectively. Focusing on technologies critical to US National Security, it identifies venture capital investment opportunities, works with startups to deliver new capabilities, and serves as an advisor to government partners.

Rand Corporation.name: Rand Corporation
Rand Corporation.description: The RAND Corporation is a nonprofit, nonpartisan research organization that develops solutions to public policy challenges to help make communities throughout the world safer, healthier, and more prosperous. They deliver fact-based, actionable policy solutions grounded in rigorous analysis.
